intro: Borzicactus neoroezlii, commonly known as the narrow-ribed borzicactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stem with closely spaced, narrow ribs and spines that are typically pale yellow to brown in color. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers during the summer months, which are often clustered at the ends of the stems. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal rainfall and high temperatures. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
